subject: Re: [junit] Can I make junit run a testcase with difference setUp()?

messageBody:
Carfield Yim wrote:

> Hi all, currently our system support 3 database and we have some
> junit testcase to test it.
>
> However, it is easy for developer only test one DB but forget the other
> 2 and assume it work. I would like to figure out a mechenism to make the
> testcase automatically run 3 time with difference DB connection setUp().
>
> Currently every testcase already inherienced from a common base class
> call Databasetestcase which setup and teardown the connection. Can I
> make some trick to this class to make it happen, rather than make a
> custom patch of junit?

I recommend this approach:

1. Externalize the database connection parameters into JVM properties.
2. Execute the test suite three times (from Ant, for example) with
different JVM properties for each set of database connection parameters.

This is probably the path of least difficulty.
